medical_history.chief_complaint: New, sudden-onset, postprandial epigastric and left upper quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began shortly after eating a light dinner. It did not improve with rest. Patient endorsed nausea and vomited bilious material following arrival at the hospital. Symptoms were persistent leading to the patient seeking medical attention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD), history of myocardial infarction (MI) and coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), atrial fibrillation, chronic kidney disease (CKD), peripheral vascular disease (PVD), hypertension (HTN), diabetes mellitus type 2 (IDDM), chronic heart failure with reduced ejection fraction, severe lymphedema, and a history of cerebrovascular stroke.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of early MI, arrhythmia, cardiomyopathies, or sudden cardiac death. Mother has hypertension, thyroid cancer, and cerebrovascular disease. Father died of unspecified causes at an unspecified age.
